tit.cmt: 峠の名称については、神社等と同様 XX-toge Passと訳しているものもありますが用語集を参照し、今回は全て -toge抜きで訳出しました。
tit.e: Mikyozaka-toge Pass (a pass on a national route in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Mikyozaka-toge Pass (a pass on a national route in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)

sen.j: 御経坂峠（みきょうざかとうげ）は京都府京都市右京区内にある国道上の峠である。
sen.e: Mikyozaka Pass ("Mikyozaka Toge" in Japanese) is located on a national route in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Mikyozaka-toge Pass is a pass on a national route in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Mikyozaka-toge Pass is a pass on a national route in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: また別名として単に御経坂とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also sometimes called simply 'Mikyozaka'.
It is also sometimes called simply Mikyozaka.
It is also sometimes called simply Mikyozaka.

sen.j: 標高216mの国道162号上に位置する峠である。
sen.e: Mikyozaka Pass is located on National Route 162 at a height of 216 meters.
It is the pass located on National Route 162 at an altitude of 216 meters.
It is the pass located on National Route 162 at an altitude of 216 meters.

sen.j: 京都市右京区内の梅ヶ畑蓮華谷と同区梅ヶ畑御経坂町を隔てている。
sen.e: It separates Umegahata-rengetani in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City from Umegahata-mikyozaka-cho.
It separates Umegahata-rengetani, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City from Umegahata-mikyozaka-cho in the same ward.
It separates Umegahata-rengetani, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City from Umegahata-mikyozaka-cho in the same ward.

sen.j: 周山街道の別名を持つ国道162号において京都から若狭を目指す場合、最も初めに越えなければならない峠である。
sen.e: Mikyozaka is the first pass crossed by National Route 162 (also known as Shuzan-kaido Road) when traveling from Kyoto to Wakasa.
Mikyozaka is the first pass crossed by National Route 162, also known as Shuzan-kaido Road, when traveling from Kyoto to Wakasa.
Mikyozaka is the first pass crossed by National Route 162, also known as Shuzan-kaido Road, when traveling from Kyoto to Wakasa.

sen.j: 峠には地蔵は見当たらないが、地名看板にて御経坂峠との案内が出ている。
sen.e: Although there are no Jizo (guardian deity of travelers) statues along the roadside of Mikyozaka Pass, there are road signs showing the name of the pass.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although there are no Jizo (guardian deity of travelers) statues along the roadside of Mikyozaka-toge Pass, there are road signs showing the name of the pass.
Although there are no Jizo (guardian deity of travelers) statues along the roadside of Mikyozaka-toge Pass, there are road signs showing the name of the pass.

sen.j: 古くから残る峠が姿を消していく中、現代にもしっかりその名を残す峠である。
sen.e: Whereas other historical passes have been lost, the name of Mikyozaka Pass survives.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Whereas other historical passes have been lost, the name of Mikyozaka-toge Pass survives.
Whereas other historical passes have been lost, the name of Mikyozaka-toge Pass survives.

sen.j: 片側1車線の確保された道路を持つ峠である。
sen.e: The pass has a road with one lane in each direction.
The pass has a road with double lane.
The pass has a road with double lane.

sen.j: しかし京都市内側は家屋が道路ぎりぎりに立っているので、それまでの道路幅より若干狭くなる。
sen.e: However the section of the road adjacent to Kyoto city center has houses built right up to the side of the road, so the road here is slightly narrower than the previous section.
However the section of the road adjacent to Kyoto City center has houses built right up to the side of the road, so the road here is slightly narrower than the previous section.
However the section of the road adjacent to Kyoto City center has houses built right up to the side of the road, so the road here is slightly narrower than the previous section.

sen.j: 急カーブが連続し、峠道らしい勾配がある区間もあるが通行量は多い。
sen.e: The pass has many tight curves, and slopes typical of a pass, but it still has a lot of traffic.
The pass has many tight curves, and slopes typical of a pass, but it still has a lot of traffic.
The pass has many tight curves, and slopes typical of a pass, but it still has a lot of traffic.

sen.j: 福井県から京都市内に入る幹線である。
sen.e: It is one of the main routes from Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto city center.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is one of the main routes from Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto City center.
It is one of the main routes from Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto City center.

sen.j: それと同時に、嵐山高雄パークウェイへのアクセスも担う国道162号の中でも最も混雑する区間である。
sen.e: It also allows access to Arashiyama-Takao Parkway and is the busiest section of National Route 162.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It also allows access to Arashiyama-Takao Parkway and is the busiest section of National Route 162.
It also allows access to Arashiyama-Takao Parkway and is the busiest section of National Route 162.

sen.j: 特に秋は紅葉の名所である為、休日には渋滞は必至である。
sen.e: Especially at holiday time in autumn, traffic congestion on the road is almost inevitable as the roadside is used a viewing spot for the changing colors of autumnal leaves.
Especially at holiday time in autumn, traffic congestion on the road is almost inevitable as the roadside is famous for the beautiful colored autumnal leaves.
Especially at holiday time in autumn, traffic congestion on the road is almost inevitable as the roadside is famous for the beautiful colored autumnal leaves.

tit.j: 峠付近からの接続道路

sen.j: 嵐山高雄パークウェイ
sen.e: Arashiyama-Takao Parkway
Arashiyama-Takao Parkway
Arashiyama-Takao Parkway

sen.j: 笠峠（京都市北区 (京都市)・同市右京区）
sen.e: Kasa Pass (Kita Ward and Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Kasa-toge Pass (Kita Ward and Ukyo Ward, both in Kyoto City)
Kasa-toge Pass (Kita Ward and Ukyo Ward, both in Kyoto City)
